Stephen Grinich, Warrior Founder
As competitive college athletes, my swimming teammates and I experienced overuse injuries during intense training periods. I experienced shoulder impingement annually, especially from overuse two months before competing at the NCAA Division 3 National Championships. As a weekend warrior I have experienced runner’s knee and jumper’s knee from activities like climbing and snowboarding. Common overuse injuries cause activity downtime, pain, costly procedures and aggravation in nearly all athletes. These are especially frustrating without access to convenient and on-demand care.
In my career in telehealth I have seen the tremendous benefits of virtual care in increasing access to high quality primary care. This has only been emphasized by the pandemic. 46% of US consumers have now conducted a telehealth visit, up from 11% in 2019. 80% of physicians have now provided care virtually, up from 22% in 2019.
Despite the prevalence of overuse injuries across all levels of physical activity, there is no telehealth service focused on providing sports medicine. I am creating Warrior as an accessible, convenient, and high quality digital health sports medicine platform focused on athletic performance, starting with overuse injuries.
Warrior
The next generation of care for athletes
